element.name: Chart
element.documentation: A chart of an area in a given format.

element.name: Chart generation
element.documentation:
A generic chart generation can - use either the (openseamap planet and the large sea datasets) or a predefined area extract, and - do adhoc area extriction from them to generate input data - and/or use the tileserver interface to obtain raster data, which - can be augmented with a base map from a tileserver - then do whatever conversion is necessary to create the chart
The quality of the chart can be enhanced by - editing the openstreetmap databse - editing one of the sea datasets - editing rules of symbols

element.name: Openseamap tile server
element.documentation: The tile server serving the openseamap layer. Ideally uses other interfaces, and serves also as an example on how to use them.

element.name: Tileserver for base map
element.documentation: These are in the existing infrastructure, provide no marine use specific tiles. http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tile_servers

element.name: Chart generator tool
element.documentation: A tool to generate a chart in a specific format for a given area.

element.name: Adhoc area extraction
element.documentation: This step is the first performed by any map generator. This should have a well-defined interface.

element.name: Area extraction tool
element.documentation: osmosis on steroids extracts an area using the openseamap planet file and large sea datasets it is also able to extract an area from an area extract for a larger one

element.name: Tile generator tool
element.documentation: This view contains everything for the wholistically minded

element.name: Area extracts for predefined areas
element.documentation: Still osm xml format. Contains every data for the given area, including the parts from the large sea datasets.

element.name: Large sea datasets
element.documentation: Large datasets should be merged with the openseamap planet when data for an area is extracted for further processing.

element.name: openseamap planet
element.documentation: The sea specific data in openstreetmap xml format.

element.name: Predefined area extraction
element.documentation: Considered as - testbed for area extraction tool - help for those who generate more maps from an area (can run area extraction from local file).

element.name: Sea data extraction
element.documentation: Entities which are (or can be) needed for marine chart generation are extracted. These are the ones defined in the S57 standard, and mapped to openstreetmap data. See http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/User:Skippern/INT-1 http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/OpenSeaMap/INT-1_Cross_Reference

element.name: Sea datasets
element.documentation: Data is to be primarily stored in the openstreetmap database. Sea specific datasets are either - those which should not be added/imported to openstreetmap (see http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Import/Guidelines, http://www.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Data_Working_Group ) - experimental ones

element.name: Small sea datasets
element.documentation: Small datasets can be imported to the openseamap planet in the S57 extraction step..

element.name: Chart generators should have ways to work with handleable sized datasets
Seamark data is much smaller than the whole opensreetmap one
Some data are not acceptable in openstreetmap
Ad-hoc chart generation
element.documentation: I would allow it only for basic raster formats for the area in the browser's screen, and when the area on screen is not covered by a chart in the given zoom level. In other cases I would provide a link for the adequate chart.

element.name: chart definitions
element.documentation: Chart definition files driving the chart generators. They can be manually constructed, and the predefined ones are defined in and can be extracted from (ideally) openstreetmap database or (less ideally) from a small sea dataset.

element.name: Chart downloader interface
element.documentation: Actually there would be some file service where the latest predefined charts can be downloaded, and also an interface on the web based map where charts covering and within the viewed area could be downloaded.

element.name: Rules and Symbols
element.documentation: Rules and symbols tell how to graphically represent

element.name: Rules and symbols format
element.documentation: This should be a well-defined interface to help those who want to enhance map quality. Ways to propose changes (e.g. issue a merge request here-and-there) should also be clearly stated.

element.name: Chart definition format
element.documentation: A common way to describe what to be mapped, which is independent from the type of the chart; all chart generators can understand the basic parameters

element.name: Area extraction interface
element.documentation: The interface here is the way to parameterize the area extraction tool, and the format of the area extract.

element.name: Openseamap planet and area file service
element.documentation: It serves the openseamap planet file, the large sea datasets, and extracts for predefined areas.

element.name: Sea datasets interface
element.documentation: The format, and -where applicable - the ways of editing the dataset and get changes approved should be defined.

element.name: The mapper/developer should have ways to fix data/tools for all steps of generation
